title: Chinese Pork Stew
description: An easy peasy, super tasty & aromatic meal which is actually very easy to make.
overview: A super tasty and aromatic Chinese pork stew, perfect for a comforting meal.

ingredients.title: Main
content: 1 large white onion, sliced into strands

stages.title: Step 1
content: Add your pork to a bowl and pour the soy sauces over. Leave to marinate for an hour or two.

stages.title: Step 3
content: On the hob in a large pot, heat up a good glug of sesame oil and, once hot, add the onions. When tender but not fully softened, add the pork.

stages.title: Step 4
content: As the pork fries, add the five spice, garlic, ginger, honey, and black pepper.

stages.title: Step 5
content: Once the pork is cooked, add the rice wine and a cup of water along with the clove, tangerine peel, and cinnamon. Let it simmer for 5 minutes.

stages.title: Step 6
content: Place the pot in the oven and let it caramelise and reduce down for 40 minutes.

stages.title: Step 7
content: Remove the cinnamon, tangerine peel, and clove, and serve your stew with rice and pak choi.

notes.note: The tangerine peel can be prepared by leaving some peel out for a few hours, or baking it on very low heat for an hour.
Don’t forget to remove the clove! It’s very easy to forget and hard to find again, and biting into a clove is not a pleasant experience.
